description.value: An extension to provide the manner in which medication is discontinued (temporary or definitive).

purpose.value: This extension represents the MedicationAgreementStopType concept of the Dutch [zib ('Zorginformatiebouwsteen', i.e. Health and Care Information Model) MedicationAgreement v3.0 (2024)](https://zibs.nl/wiki/MedicationAgreement-v3.0(2024EN)).

definition.value:
This MedicationAgreementStopType modifier extension works differently than the `.status` element of resources because it has a different meaning. The `.status` element usually represents the status of the resource at the moment of exchanging the resource. This means that over the lifetime of a resource, the status may change (and is very much related to use period). That – in itself – makes solely mapping MedicationAgreementStopType (which may never change in an instance) to `.status` not suitable.
For example: suppose you want the patient to stop taking medication definitively three days from today. This is a stop medication agreement with a StopType of _definitive_. However today, tomorrow and the day after tomorrow the `.status` of this medication agreement is _active_ and only after the end date of the usage period the `.status` should be _stopped_. Status and StopType are simply not the same thing.

isModifierReason.value: This element is labeled as a modifier because MedicationAgreementStopType contains codes that mark the resource as no longer active.

definition.value: Stop type, the manner in which this medication is discontinued or canceled (temporary, definitive or canceled).
